oneOf.description: Receives an AMPMsg, creates a new AMPPkt that contains the AMPMsg and sends it to the recipient

AMPMsg.description: This struct defines how the kernel parses and relays messages between ADOs If the desired recipient is via IBC then namespacing must be employed The attached message must be a binary encoded execute message for the receiving ADO Funds can be attached for an individual message and will be attached accordingly

config.description: When the message should reply, defaults to Always

funds.description: Any funds to be attached to the message, defaults to an empty vector

message.description: The message to be sent to the recipient

recipient.description: The message recipient, can be a contract/wallet address or a namespaced URI

AMPMsgConfig.description:
The configuration of the message to be sent.

Used when a sub message is generated for the given AMP Msg (only used in the case of Wasm Messages).

direct.description: Whether to send the message directly to the given recipient

exit_at_error.description: Determines whether the operation should terminate or proceed upon a failed message

gas_limit.description: An optional imposed gas limit for the message

reply_on.description: When the message should reply, defaults to Always

AMPPkt.description: An Andromeda packet contains all message protocol related data, this is what is sent between ADOs when communicating It contains an original sender, if used for authorisation the sender must be authorised The previous sender is the one who sent the message A packet may contain several messages which allows for message batching

messages.description: Any messages associated with the packet

AndrAddr.description:
An address that can be used within the Andromeda ecosystem. Inspired by the cosmwasm-std `Addr` type. https://github.com/CosmWasm/cosmwasm/blob/2a1c698520a1aacedfe3f4803b0d7d653892217a/packages/std/src/addresses.rs#L33

This address can be one of two things: 1. A valid human readable address e.g. `cosmos1...` 2. A valid Andromeda VFS path e.g. `/home/user/app/component`

VFS paths can be local in the case of an app and can be done by referencing `./component` they can also contain protocols for cross chain communication. A VFS path is usually structured as so:

`<protocol>://<chain (required if ibc used)>/<path>` or `ibc://cosmoshub-4/user/app/component`

Binary.description:
Binary is a wrapper around Vec<u8> to add base64 de/serialization with serde. It also adds some helper methods to help encode inline.

This is only needed as serde-json-{core,wasm} has a horrible encoding for Vec<u8>. See also <https://github.com/CosmWasm/cosmwasm/blob/main/docs/MESSAGE_TYPES.md>.

ReplyOn.description: Use this to define when the contract gets a response callback. If you only need it for errors or success you can select just those in order to save gas.

oneOf.description: Always perform a callback after SubMsg is processed
Only callback if SubMsg returned an error, no callback on success case
Only callback if SubMsg was successful, no callback on error case
Never make a callback - this is like the original CosmosMsg semantics
